meanings.definition: Cause (something) to change direction by interposing something; turn aside from a straight course.
meanings.sent1: She quickly moved her hand, deflecting the ball away from hitting her face.
meanings.sent2: The mirror was deflecting the sunlight into the room, brightening it up.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat enjoyed deflecting the laser pointer beam all around the room.
meanings.sent4: His calm demeanor acted as a shield, deflecting any negative comments that came his way.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's shield was so powerful that it was capable of deflecting even the strongest attacks.

meanings.definition: Turn aside from a straight course or intended purpose.
meanings.sent1: The student tried to deflect the teacher's attention away from the unfinished homework.
meanings.sent2: The river's strong current was deflecting the boat off its intended path.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes were so funny that they kept deflecting the audience's focus from the main topic.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a magnet, deflecting her from any distractions that came her way.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected turn of events deflected their plans, forcing them to come up with a new strategy.

meanings.definition: To cause (something that is moving) to change direction.
meanings.sent1: The goalie's quick reflexes deflected the soccer ball away from the goal.
meanings.sent2: The wind was deflecting the leaves in all directions, creating a beautiful dance in the air.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel enjoyed deflecting the acorns towards unsuspecting passersby.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude acted as a shield, deflecting any negativity that came her way.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse's beam was so strong that it could deflect ships away from the dangerous rocks.
